page.title: 14Communications in Sebergham
page.content: Communications are perhaps less now than in earlier times, with more cars people walk through and between the villages less and consequently meet each other less. This is very detrimental to the cohesion of the community. Telephones are in virtually every house and are used very much for keep- ing in touch with friends and family. Old divisions between the Church of England and the Methodists are slowly giving way to a more understanding oecumenical attitude between people of different creeds. Methodists attend the Church of England services more readily than the reverse. Attendances at church and chapel are declining both with more easily available transport and less resident ministers to keep the church alive.
